column1: EVTDESC1000188000;As could be expected
column2: after learning of your intention to attack him
column3: the Pope has cast the Anathema on you. You are now excommunicated.;Comme il falloit s'y attendre
column4: quand il apprit votre intention de l'attaquer
column5: le Pape vous à declaré Anathème. Vous estes désormais excommunié.;Erwartungsgemäß
column6: erklärte der Papst Sie Anathema als er hörte Sie drangen in ihn. Sie sind exkommuniziert.;;Como se podia esperar
column7: despues de que se entero de su intencion de atacarle
column8: el Papa te ha declarado Anatema. Ahora estas excomunicado.;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC1000188001;Our suzerain is now marching against the true Pope. Our suzerain has temporal authority over us
column2: but the Pope's spiritual authority comes from God Himself! Shall we join the Guelfs
column3: defenders of the Holy Father?;Notre suzerain fait la guerre au Pape légitime. Notre suzerain detient sur nous l'autorité temporelle
column4: mais l'autorité spirituelle du Pape découle de Dieu Lui-mesme! Devrions-nous rejoindre les Guelphes
column5: défenseurs du Saint-Père ?;Unsere Suzerän jetzt führt Krieg gegen den wahren Papst. Unsere Suzerän hat weltliche Autorität über uns
column6: aber geistliche Autorität des Papstes kommt von Gott selbst! Sollten wir die Guelfen
column7: Verteidigern des Heiliger Vater
column8: beitreten?;;Nuestro señor feudal está marchando en contra del verdadero Papa. Nuestro señor feudal tiene la autoridad temporal sobre nosotros
column9: pero la autoridad espiritual del Papa viene de Dios mismo!¿Hay que unirse a los güelfos
column10: defensores del Papa?;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC1000188002;War between temporal and spiritual powers has broken out again. Are we Guelfs
column2: or Ghibellines?;La guerre fait de nouveau rage entre le pouvoir spirituel et temporel. Sommes-nous Guelphes
column3: ou Gibellins ?;Ein neues Krieg kommt
column4: weltlich Macht gegen geistlich Macht. Sind wir Guelfen
column5: oder Ghibellinen?;;Una nueva guerra se acerca
column6: el poder secular contra el poder espiritual. ¿Estamos güelfos o gibelinos?;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC1000188003;The war is over..we must pay at least lip service to our oaths.;La guerre est finie. Nous devons au moins faire semblant de respecter nos serments.;Der Krieg ist vorbei. Wir müssen zumindest so tun
column2: als unsere Eide zu respektieren.;;La guerra ha terminado. Por lo menos debemos pretender respetar nuestros juramentos.;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC1007000;An opportunity has arisen to attempt the kidnapping of [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]. My fellow plotters are just waiting for my signal to proceed.;Une occasion s'est présentée de tenter l'enlèvement de [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]. Mes collègues conspirateurs n'attendent que mon signal pour commencer.;Eine Gelegenheit ist entstanden
column2: um die Entführung von [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] zu versuchen. Meine Verschwörer warten nur auf mein Signal
column3: um fortzufahren.;;An opportunity has arisen to attempt the kidnapping of [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]. My fellow plotters are just waiting for my signal to proceed.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1007001;As I was sleeping
column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] broke into my bedchamber and put a dagger to my throat. I was forced out into the courtyard
column3: where [From.GetHerHis] co-conspirators were waiting on fast horses. [From.GetTitledFirstName] now has me locked up in the basement of [From.GetHerHis] manor and is demanding that I give [From.GetHerHim] the land [From.GetSheHe] considers rightfully [From.GetHerHis]. If I refuse
column4: [From.GetSheHe] is threatening to kill me...;Alors que je dormois
column5: [From.GetTitledFirstName] a pénétré dans ma chambre et m'a mis une dague sous le gosier. J'ai été conduit jusque dans la cour
column6: où ses co-conspirateurs attendoient sur des montures fraisches. [From.GetTitledFirstName] m'a désormais enfermé au sous-sol de son castel et m'a demandé de lui donner la terre qu'[From.GetSheHe] considère comme son droit légitime. Si je refuse
column7: [From.GetSheHe] m'a menacé de m'occire...;Während ich schlief
column8: brach [From.GetTitledFirstName] in meine Kammer ein und setze mir einen Dolch an die Kehle. Ich wurde in den Innenhof gebracht wo bereits [From.GetHerHis]e Mitverschwörer mit schnellen Pferden warteten. [From.GetTitledFirstName] kerkerte mich im Verlies von [From.GetHerHis] ein und verlangte
column9: dass ich [From.GetHerHim] die Ländereien von [From.GetHerHim] an [From.GetSheHe] übergebe
column10: die rechtmäßig [From.GetHerHis] gehören. Wenn ich mich weigere
column11: droht [From.GetSheHe]
column12: mich zu töten.;;As I was sleeping
column13: [From.GetTitledFirstName] broke into my bedchamber and put a dagger to my throat. I was forced out into the courtyard
column14: where [From.GetHerHis] co-conspirators were waiting on fast horses. [From.GetTitledFirstName] now has me locked up in the basement of [From.GetHerHis] manor and is demanding that I give [From.GetHerHim] the land [From.GetSheHe] considers rightfully [From.GetHerHis]. If I refuse
column15: [From.GetSheHe] is threatening to kill me...;;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC1007002;My guards caught [From.GetTitledFirstName] just as [From.GetSheHe] was about to break into my bedchamber
column2: dagger in hand. Under interrogation
column3: [From.GetSheHe] has confessed to planning to kidnap me to force me to give [From.GetHerHim] lands and a title.;Mes gardent ont attrapé [From.GetTitledFirstName] juste au moment où [From.GetSheHe] allait pénétrer dans ma chambre
column4: dague à la main. Sous la question
column5: [From.GetSheHe] a confessé son projet de m'enlever pour me forcer à lui donner des terres et un titre.;Meine Wachen schnappten [From.GetTitledFirstName] gerade als [From.GetSheHe]  versuchte in meine Gemächer einzudringen. Mit einem Dolch in der Hand !. Im Verhör gstand  [From.GetSheHe] das er plante mich zu kidnapen um mich zu zwingen Ländereien und Titel an [From.GetHerHim] zu geben.;;My guards caught [From.GetTitledFirstName] just as [From.GetSheHe] was about to break into my bedchamber
column6: dagger in hand. Under interrogation
column7: [From.GetSheHe] has confessed to planning to kidnap me to force me to give [From.GetHerHim] lands and a title.;;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC1007010;My co-conspirators send word that they have prepared everything we need to discredit [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName]. Documents of [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] corruption have been prepared
column2: and courtiers have been bribed to whisper to [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] of [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis]'s incompetence. With [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] reputation in tatters
column3: [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName] will find it impossible to hold on to [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] position on the council.;Mes co-conspirateurs m'ont prévenu qu'ils ont préparé tout ce qu'il faut pour discréditer [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName]. Les documents compromettant ont été préparés
column4: et les courtisans ont été soudoyés répandre des rumeurs à la cour de [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]. Une fois sa réputation en lambeaulx
column5: il ne lui sera plus possible de conserver son poste à la cour;Meine Mitverschwörer senden wort
column6: dass sie alles das wir brauchen
column7: um [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName] zu diskreditieren haben. Dokumente um [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] Korruption dar zu legen wurden hergestellt und Höflinge wurden bestochen an [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] zu flüstern von [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis]'s Inkompetenz . Mit [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] Ruf in Fetzen
column8: wird [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName] es unmöglich finden um [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] Position auf dem Konzil zu halten.;;My co-conspirators send word that they have prepared everything we need to discredit [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName]. Documents of [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] corruption have been prepared
column9: and courtiers have been bribed to whisper to [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] of [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis]'s incompetence. With [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] reputation in tatters
column10: [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName] will find it impossible to hold on to [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] position on the council.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1007011;I have found myself the target of a vicious campaign of slander at court. Rumors of incompetence and corruption have undermined the authority of my position
column2: and it seems that even [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] have come to believe them as I have been removed from my position at the council.;Je me suis trouvé la cible d'une violente campagne de diffamation à la cour. Les rumeurs d'incompétence et de corruption ont miné ma réputation
column3: et il semble que mesme le/la [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] en est venu à les croire que j'ai été démis de mes fonctions au conseil.;Ich bin das Ziel einer bösartigen Verleumdungskampagne bei Hof. Gerüchte von Inkompetenz und Korruption haben die Autorität meiner Position untergraben
column4: und es scheint
column5: dass auch [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] an die Entscheidung gekommen
column6: sie zu glauben
column7: als ich von meiner Position auf dem Konzil entfernt wurden.;;I have found myself the target of a vicious campaign of slander at court. Rumors of incompetence and corruption have undermined the authority of my position
column8: and it seems that even [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] have come to believe them as I have been removed from my position at the council.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1007012;The attempt to discredit [From.GetTitledFirstName] was a success! [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] has dismissed [From.GetHerHim] from the council and [From.GetHerHis] position is now vacant and ready for me to occupy.;La tentative pour discréditer [From.GetTitledFirstName] a été un succès! [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] l'a renvoyé du conseil
column2: son poste est maintenant libre et prest pour mon investiture.;Der Versuch
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] zu diskreditieren war erfolgreich! [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] hat [From.GetHerHim] aus dem Rat abgewiesen und [From.GetHerHis] Position ist jetzt frei und bereit für mich zu besetzen.;;The attempt to discredit [From.GetTitledFirstName] was a success! [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] has dismissed [From.GetHerHim] from the council and [From.GetHerHis] position is now vacant and ready for me to occupy.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1007013;Lately it seems that I have heard nothing but bad of [From.GetTitledFirstName]
column2: from whispers of incompetence at court to documents proving [From.GetHerHis] corruption slipped under my bedroom door at night. I refused to believe it at first
column3: but in the end I could not deny the weight of the evidence and was forced to remove [From.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetHerHis] position at court.;Dernièrement
column4: j'ai ouï des rumeurs quant à l'incompétence de [From.GetTitledFirstName]. La nuit sous ma porte
column5: quelqu'un a glissé des documents prouvant son implication dans des affaires de corruption. J'ai refusé d'y croire au premier abord
column6: mais finalement je ne pouvais nier l'évidence et j'ai été contraint de retirer à [From.GetTitledFirstName] son poste à la cour.;In letzter Zeit scheint es
column7: dass ich nichts hörte
column8: außer schlechtes von [From.GetTitledFirstName]. Von Flüstern der Inkompetenz am Hof
column9: zur Dokumente von [From.GetHerHis] Korruption von die unter meiner Schlafzimmertür eines Nachtes geschlüpft wurde. Ich weigerte mich
column10: es zuerst zu glauben
column11: aber am Ende konnte ich es nicht leugnen. Das Gewicht der Beweismittel zwang mich [From.GetTitledFirstName] aus [From.GetHerHis] Stellung beim Hof zu entfernen.;;Lately it seems that I have heard nothing but bad of [From.GetTitledFirstName]
column12: from whispers of incompetence at court to documents proving [From.GetHerHis] corruption slipped under my bedroom door at night. I refused to believe it at first
column13: but in the end I could not deny the weight of the evidence and was forced to remove [From.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetHerHis] position at court.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1007014;I have found myself the target of a vicious campaign of slander at court. Whispers of incompetence and accusations of corruption have been directed at me
column2: but fortunately [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] have refused to give them credence and ordered an investigation into the source of the rumors. Although the investigation turned up nothing
column3: my position at court is secure.;Je me suis trouvé la cible d'une violente campagne de diffamation à la cour. Des rumeurs d'incompétence et des accusations de corruption ont été dirigées contre moi
column4: mais heureusement [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] à refusé de leur donner créance et a ordonné une enqueste sur la source de ces rumeurs. Bien que l'enqueste n'a rien donné
column5: ma position à la cour est sécurisée.;Ich habe mich das Ziel einer bösartigen Verleumdungskampagne beim Hof gefunden. Flüstern der Inkompetenz und vorwürfe der Korruptions sind mir angerichtet. Glücklicherweiser hat [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] sich geweigert die Glaubwürdigkeit diese vorwürfe  zu würdigen und dazu geordnet eine Untersuchung der Quelle diese Gerüchte. Obwohl die Untersuchung nichts tauchte ist meine Position beim Hof sicher.;;I have found myself the target of a vicious campaign of slander at court. Whispers of incompetence and accusations of corruption have been directed at me

column1: EVTDESC1007020;The tithes and taxes for [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] are on their way to [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] castle and my co-conspirators have bribed the guards not to notice if a chest or two should go 'missing'. column1: EVTDESC1007021;The taxes and tithes due to me arrived at the castle today and were placed in the treasury. As I was inspecting the chests full of gold
column2: it struck me that there seemed to be fewer of them than what had arrived earlier. A quick check of the treasurer's accounts revealed my worst fears...;Le convoi transportant les imposts et la dixme collectés est arrivé au castel aujourd'hui et les coffres ont été placés dans le trésor. Lorsque nous avons inspecté la livraison
column3: il m'a semblé qu'il en manquait par rapport à la précédente perception. Une vérification rapide des comptes du trésorier a confirmé mes craintes...;The taxes and tithes due to me arrived at the castle today and were placed in the treasury. As I was inspecting the chests full of gold
column4: it struck me that there seemed to be fewer of them than what had arrived earlier. A quick check of the treasurer's accounts revealed my worst fears...;;The taxes and tithes due to me arrived at the castle today and were placed in the treasury. As I was inspecting the chests full of gold
column5: it struck me that there seemed to be fewer of them than what had arrived earlier. A quick check of the treasurer's accounts revealed my worst fears...;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1007022;As the taxes were being hauled into the treasury
column2: several large chests full of gold made their way onto the back of a wagon which left the castle unnoticed. The gold is now safely locked away in my treasury and my co-conspirators have all received their share.;Les taxes ont été transportées dans le trésor
column3: plusieurs grands coffres pleins d'or ont fait leur chemin à l'arrière d'un wagon et ont quitté le castel inaperçu. L'or est désormais en toute sécurité et mes co-conspirateurs ont tous reçu leur part.;As the taxes were being hauled into the treasury
column4: several large chests full of gold made their way onto the back of a wagon which left the castle unnoticed. The gold is now safely locked away in my treasury and my co-conspirators have all received their share.;;As the taxes were being hauled into the treasury

column1: EVTDESC1007023;I have received my share of the money embezzled by [From.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.Liege.GetTitledFirstName].;J'ai reçu ma part de l'argent de [From.GetTitledFirstName] détourné par  [From.Liege.GetTitledFirstName].;I have received my share of the money embezzled by [From.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.Liege.GetTitledFirstName].;;I have received my share of the money embezzled by [From.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.Liege.GetTitledFirstName].;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC1007027;The taxes and tithes due to me arrived at the castle today. As I was watching the money being carried into the treasury
column2: I noticed some shadowy figures trying to make off with several chests full of gold. I had my guards seize them
column3: and under questioning they revealed themselves to be in the employ of [From.GetTitledFirstName]. What shall be done with my thieving vassal?;Le convoi transportant la dixme et les taxes collectées arriva au castel aujourd'hui. Alors que je surveillois le transfert
column4: j'ai remarqué quelques silhouettes qui tentoient de faire main basse sur plusieurs coffres pleins d'or. Je les ai mis sur-le-champ aulx fers et pendant l'interrogatoire
column5: ils ont révélé estre à la solde de [From.GetTitledFirstName]. Que faire de ce vassal sournois ?;The taxes and tithes due to me arrived at the castle today. As I was watching the money being carried into the treasury
column6: I noticed some shadowy figures trying to make off with several chests full of gold. I had my guards seize them
column7: and under questioning they revealed themselves to be in the employ of [From.GetTitledFirstName]. What shall be done with my thieving vassal?;;The taxes and tithes due to me arrived at the castle today. As I was watching the money being carried into the treasury
column8: I noticed some shadowy figures trying to make off with several chests full of gold. I had my guards seize them
column9: and under questioning they revealed themselves to be in the employ of [From.GetTitledFirstName]. What shall be done with my thieving vassal?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1007028;As the taxes were being hauled into the treasury
column2: my men tried to make off with several chests of gold but were spotted by [From.GetTitledFirstName]
column3: who had come out to inspect the process [From.GetHerHim]self. Under questioning they revealed to myself to be in my employ
column4: and now [From.GetTitledFirstName] knows that I attempted to rob [From.GetHerHim].;Le convoi transportant la dixme et les taxes collectées arriva au castel aujourd'hui. Mes hommes ont tenté de faire main basse sur plusieurs coffres d'or
column5: mais ont été repérés par [From.GetTitledFirstName]
column6: qui estoit sorti pour inspecter le processus . Ils ont été arresté
column7: et pendant l'interrogatoire ils ont révélé estre à mon service et maintenant [From.GetTitledFirstName] sait que j'ai essayé de [From.GetHerHim] voler.;As the taxes were being hauled into the treasury
column8: my men tried to make off with several chests of gold but were spotted by [From.GetTitledFirstName]
column9: who had come out to inspect the process [From.GetHerHim]self. Under questioning they revealed to myself to be in my employ

column12: who had come out to inspect the process [From.GetHerHim]self. Under questioning they revealed to myself to be in my employ
column13: and now [From.GetTitledFirstName] knows that I attempted to rob [From.GetHerHim].;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC1059007;Increased land productivity in [Root.GetName].;Croissance de la production des terres en [Root.GetName].;Erhöhte Produktivität der Anbauflächen in [Root.GetName].;;Increased land productivity in [Root.GetName].;;;;;;;;x;
EVTDESC1059008;Sieges could drag on for months and even years
column2: and the besieging troops had to forage the countryside for supplies. These foraging parties could sometimes devolve into looting and outright vandalism. This was the case in [Root.Location.GetName]
column3: where our troops have have pillaged and torched one of the province's buildings.;Les sièges pouvoient se prolonger pendant des mois
column4: voire des années
column5: et les troupes qui assiégeoient avoient besoin de vivres pour s'approvisionner. Ces questes de victuailles pouvoient parfois se transformer en pillage et en vandalisme pur et simple. Ce fut le cas en [Root.Location.GetName]
column6: où nos troupes ont pillé et incendié l'un des bastiments de la province.;Belagerungen konnten sich über Monate und sogar Jahre hinziehen
column7: und die belagernden Truppen mussten sich aus der Umgebung selbst versorgen. Diese Suche führte manchmal auch zu Plünderungen und Vandalismus. Dies war der Fall in [Root.Location.GetName]
column8: wo unsere Truppen geplündert und ein Gebäude in Brand gesteckt haben.;;Sieges could drag on for months and even years
column9: and the besieging troops had to forage the countryside for supplies. These foraging parties could sometimes devolve into looting and outright vandalism. This was the case in [Root.Location.GetName]
column10: where our troops have have pillaged and torched one of the province's buildings.;;;;;;;;x;

column1: EVTDESC1059009;The besieging troops have destroyed a building in [From.Location.GetName]!;Les troupes de l'assiégeants ont détruit un bastiment en [From.Location.GetName]!;Die belagernden Truppen haben ein Gebäude in [From.Location.GetName] zerstört!;;The besieging troops have destroyed a building in [From.Location.GetName]!;;;;;;;;x;
EVTDESC1061001;To the feeble [Root.GetTitledName]\n\nThe undefeatable armies of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are at your borders. Submit
column2: and you shall be allowed to live and rule your lands as my vassal. Resist
column3: and I will burn your cities
column4: enslave your people and see your head mounted on a pike outside my tent.\n\nYour lord and master
column5: [From.GetTitledFirstName];Au faible [Root.GetTitledName]\n\nLes armées invincibles de l'[From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] sont à vos frontières. Soumettez-vous
column6: et nous vous autoriserons à vivre et gouverner vos terres en tant que notre féal vassal. Résistez
column7: et nous bruslerons vos bourgs
column8: asservirons votre peuple et planterons votre teste sur une pique.\n\nVotre seigneur et maistre
column9: [From.GetTitledFirstName];An dem schwachen [Root.GetTitledName]\n\nDie unbesiegbaren Armeen der [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] sind an Ihre Grenzen gesammelt. Ergebe
column10: und Sie dürfen leben und Ihre Ländereien regieren als mein Vasall. Widerstehe
column11: und ich werde eure Städte verbrennen
column12: dein Volk versklaven
column13: und dazu sehen das Ihren Kopf vor meinem Zelt auf einem Spieß montiert wird. \n\nDein Herr und Meister
column14: [From.GetTitledFirstName];;To the feeble [Root.GetTitledName]\n\nThe undefeatable armies of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are at your borders. Submit
column15: and you shall be allowed to live and rule your lands as my vassal. Resist
column16: and I will burn your cities
column17: enslave your people and see your head mounted on a pike outside my tent.\n\nYour lord and master
column18: [From.GetTitledFirstName];;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC110000;It seems as though a great change has occured in my life.;Il semble qu'un grand changement soit arrivé dans ma vie.;Es scheint
column2: als ob eine große Änderung in meinem Leben geschehen wird.;;It seems as though a great change has occured in my life.;;;;;;;x;;

column1:
EVTDESC1100000;To [Root.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetTitledFirstName]

The [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] is being attacked by heathens bent on conquering all [Root.Religion.GetName] lands. I ask that you put aside our differences and aid me in defending the true faith against these faithless villains.;À [Root.GetTitledFirstName] de [From.GetTitledFirstName]

Le [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] est attaqué par des païens désirant conquérir toutes les terres [Root.Religion.GetName]. Je vous demande de mettre de costé nos différents et de me rejoindre dans la défense de la vraie foi contre ces barbares mécréants.;An [Root.GetTitledFirstName] von [From.GetTitledFirstName]

Der [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] wird von heidnischen Horden überrannt
column2: die solange weiterziehen werden
column3: bis alle Länder des [Root.Religion.GetName]en Glaubens erobert sind. Ich bitte Euch
column4: unsere Differenzen einstweilen beiseite zu lassen und mir zu helfen
column5: mich gegen diese gottlosen Schurken zu verteidigen.;;To [Root.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetTitledFirstName]\n\nThe [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] is being attacked by heathens bent on conquering all [Root.Religion.GetName] lands. I ask that you put aside our differences and aid me in defending the true faith against these faithless villains.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1100001;I am being attacked by enemies of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. Should I ask my neighbours to help defend my lands?;Je suis attaqué par les ennemis de la foi [Root.Religion.GetName]. devrois-je demander à mes voisins de m'aider à défendre mes terres?;Ich werde von Feinden des [Root.Religion.GetName]en Glaubens angegriffen. Vielleicht sollte ich meine Nachbarn um Unterstützung bitten?;;I am being attacked by enemies of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. Should I ask my neighbours to help defend my lands?;;;;;;;;x;

EVTDESC1100002;To [Root.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetTitledFirstName]

Of course I will join you in defending the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] against these wicked heathens. Together we will drive them from your realm in the name of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith!;À [Root.GetTitledFirstName] de [From.GetTitledFirstName]

Bien susr que je vais vous rejoindre dans la défense de [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] contre ces mauvais païens. Ensemble nous allons les bouter hors de votre Royaume au nom de la foi [Root.Religion.GetName]!;An [Root.GetTitledFirstName] von [From.GetTitledFirstName]

 Natürlich helfe ich Euch bei der Verteidigung [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]s gegen diese gottlosen Heiden. Gemeinsam werden wir diese Monster im Namen des [Root.Religion.GetName]en Glaubens aus Eurem Reiche jagen!;;To [Root.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetTitledFirstName]

Of course I will join you in defending the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] against these wicked heathens. Together we will drive them from your realm in the name of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith!;;;;;;;;x;

EVTDESC110024;Some of my newly acquired titles had crown laws that are anathema to the true [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. I have changed the laws accordingly.;Certains de mes titres nouvellement acquis ont des lois d'État qui sont un anathème pour la vraie foi [Root.Religion.GetName]. J'ai changé les statuts en conséquence.;Einige meiner neu erworbenen Titeln hatte Kronegesetze die ein Dorn im Auge des wahren Glaubens sind. Ich habe die Gesetze entsprechend geändert.;;Some of my newly acquired titles had crown laws that are anathema to the true [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. I have changed the laws accordingly.;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC110040;I have arranged for the sale of my old estates so that I can concentrate my wealth to the lands that I now hold.;Je me suis arrangé pour vendre mes anciens domaines afin que je puisse consacrer ma richesse aulx terres que je détiens.;Ich habe den Verkauf meinen alten Anwesen angeordnet
column2: so dass ich meinen Reichtum zu den Ländern
column3: die ich jetzt halte
column4: zusammen sammeln kann.;;I have arranged for the sale of my old estates so that I can concentrate my wealth to the lands that I now hold.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC110043;How can I be crowned if I am not the Emperor?;Comment pourrois-je estre couronné si je ne suis point l'Empereur ?;Wie kann ich gekrönt werden
column2: wenn ich nicht der Kaiser bin?;;How can I be crowned if I am not the Emperor?;;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC110044;A new [Root.GetTitle] now rules [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].;Un nouveau [Root.GetTitle] dirige maintenant [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].;A new [Root.GetTitle] now rules [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].;;A new [Root.GetTitle] now rules [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].;;;;;;;x;;
EVTDESC110045;I have converted to the true faith.;Je me suis converti à la Vraie Foi.;Ich habe mich zum wahren Glauben bekannt.;;I have converted to the true faith.;;;;;;;x;;

EVTDESC110051;I have been granted sanction to fight the enemies of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith!;J'ai obtenu l'autorisation de guerroyer les ennemis de la foi [Root.Religion.GetName] !;Mir ist Sanktion gewährt worden
column2: um die Feinde des [Root.Religion.GetName]en Glaubens zu bekämpfen!;;I have been granted sanction to fight the enemies of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith!;;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC110052;My request for sanction to fight against the enemies of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith was denied.;Ma demande d'autorisation pour guerroyer les ennemis du [Root.Religion.GetName] a été rejetée.;Meine Bitte
column2: die Feinde des [Root.Religion.GetName]en Glaubens zu bekämpfen
column3: wurde abgelehnt.;;My request for sanction to fight against the enemies of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith was denied.;;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC110060;I am dying
column2: but my heir will continue the battle and bring this civil war to a successful conclusion.;Je meurs
column3: mais mon héritier continuera la lutte et pacifiera notre pays déchiré par la guerre civile.;I am dying
column4: but my heir will continue the battle and bring this civil war to a successful conclusion.;;I am dying
column5: but my heir will continue the battle and bring this civil war to a successful conclusion.;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC110064;Who am I rebelling towards exactly?;Contre qui suis-je en train de me rebeller exactement ?;Gegen wem rebelle ich nun?;;Who am I rebelling towards exactly?;;;;;;;;;

column2: exactly?;Contre qui suis-je en train de me rebeller exactement ?;Gegen wem rebelle ich nun?;;Who am I rebelling against

column1: EVTDESC1200000;The Clergy wishes to send a mission to convince my Pagan neighbour to convert to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. They assure me that these Pagan lands can be brought into the arms of the church if I only agree to fund the endeavour.;Le clergé veult envoyer une mission pour convaincre mon voisin païen de se convertir à la foi [Root.Religion.GetName]. Ils m'assurent que ces terres païennes peuvent estre mis dans les bras de l'église seulement si je suis d'accord pour financer l'effort.;Der Klerus möchte eine Mission zu unseren heidnischen Nachbarn schicken
column2: damit sie zum [Root.Religion.GetName]en Glauben bekehrt werden. Sie versichern mir
column3: dass diese heidnischen Ländereien in die Arme unseres Glaubens gebracht werden könnten
column4: sobald ich zustimme
column5: die Reise zu finanzieren.;;The Clergy wishes to send a mission to convince my Pagan neighbour to convert to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. They assure me that these Pagan lands can be brought into the arms of the church if I only agree to fund the endeavour.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1200001;A delegation of missionaries arrived today from [From.GetTitledName] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. They offered me expensive gifts and spoke at length of the merits of the [From.Religion.GetName] faith and my assured salvation if I was to convert.;Une délégation de missionnaires est arrivée aujourd'hui depuis le [From.GetTitledName] de [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. Ils m'ont offert des cadeaulx cousteulx
column2: ont longuement parlé des mérites de la foi [From.Religion.GetName] et m'ont assuré le salut de mon asme si j'accepte de me convertir à leur religion.;Eine Delegation von Missionaren kam heute aus [From.GetTitledName] von [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. Sie boten mir kostspielige Geschenke und sprachen ausführlich von den Vorzügen des [From.Religion.GetName]en Glaubens und versicherten mich des ewigen Heils
column3: wenn ich konvertierte.;;A delegation of missionaries arrived today from [From.GetTitledName] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. They offered me expensive gifts and spoke at length of the merits of the [From.Religion.GetName] faith and my assured salvation if I was to convert.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1200002;The mission to the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] was a success! [From.GetTitledName] has converted to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.;La mission de l'[From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] a été un succès! [From.GetTitledName] a été converti à la foi [Root.Religion.GetName].;Die Mission nach [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] war ein Erfolg! [From.GetTitledName] wurde zum [Root.Religion.GetName]en Glauben bekehrt.;;T;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC1200003;The mission to the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] was a failure. [From.GetTitledName] took the offered gifts but made only vague promises of respecting the rights of our missionaries.;La mission de l'[From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] a été un échec. [From.GetTitledName] a pris les cadeaulx offerts
column2: mais ne fit que de vagues promesses.;Die Mission nach [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] war ein Misserfolg. [From.GetTitledName] nahm die angebotenen Geschenke
column3: machte aber nur vage Versprechungen von der Achtung der Rechte unserer Missionare.;;The mission to the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] was a failure. [From.GetTitledName] took the offered gifts but made only vague promises of respecting the rights of our missionaries.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1200004;The mission to the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] was a failure. [From.GetTitledName] refused to even accept the gifts of our missionaries
column2: choosing instead to expel them from the realm.;La mission de l'[From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] a été un échec. [From.GetTitledName] a mesme refusé d'accepter les dons de nos missionnaires
column3: choisissant plutost de les expulser du royaume.;Die Mission nach [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] war ein Misserfolg. [From.GetTitledName] verweigerte die Geschenke unserer Missionare und entschied
column4: sie lieber aus dem Reich zu vertreiben.;;The mission to the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] was a failure. [From.GetTitledName] refused to even accept the gifts of our missionaries
column5: choosing instead to expel them from the realm.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1400002;My scholarship and piousness has earned me respect from the [Root.Religion.GetName] priesthood. The moral authority of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith has been strengthened.;Mon érudition et ma piété m'ont valu le respect des prestres [Root.Religion.GetName]. L'autorité morale de la foi [Root.Religion.GetName] a été renforcée;Mein Gelehrsamkeit und Frömmigkeit hat mir den Respekt des Priestertums gebracht. Die moralische Autorität des [Root.Religion.GetName]en Glaubens wurde gestärkt.;;My scholarship and piousness has earned me respect from the [Root.Religion.GetName] priesthood. The moral authority of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith has been strengthened.;;;;;;;;x;

EVTDESC1400003;The priesthood of [Root.Religion.GetName] complain incessantly about my lack of scholarship and piety. The moral authority of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith has been weakened as a result.;Les ecclésiastiques [Root.Religion.GetName] se plaignent sans cesse de mon manque de piété et d'érudition. L'autorité morale de la foi [Root.Religion.GetName] a été affaiblie.;Das Priestertum beklagt sich ohne Unterlass über meinen Mangel an Gelehrsamkeit und Frömmigkeit. Die moralische Autorität des [Root.Religion.GetName]en Glaubens hat sich deswegen abgeschwächt.;;The priesthood of [Root.Religion.GetName] complain incessantly about my lack of scholarship and piety. The moral authority of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith has been weakened as a result.;;;;;;x;;;

EVTDESC18700;Several Kingdoms in Europe are fighting to keep the pagans back and try to spread Christianity eastwards. The Livonian Order should assist them by offering to settle on their borders.;Plusieurs royaumes d’Europe guerroient pour repousser les païens et tenter de propager le christianisme vers l’orient. L’Ordre Teutonique devroit les assister en leur proposant de s’installer sur leur frontière.;Mehrere europäische Königreiche kämpfen gegen den Vormarsch der Heiden und versuchen
column2: das Christentum in östlicher Richtung zu verbreiten. Der Deutsche Orden sollte sie unterstützen
column3: indem er seine Ansiedlung an ihren Grenzen anbietet.;;Varios reinos de Europa luchan por detener a los paganos e intentan difundir el cristianismo hacia el este. La Orden Teutónica debería ayudarles permitiéndoles asentarse en sus fronteras.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18701;To the Great [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
column2: \nYour wisdom and mercy are legendary. The Livonian Order wishes to assist you in your valiant struggle against the pagans. By transfering a border County to the order
column3: we will be able to establish a local presence and fight these heathens.;À l’attention du(de la) Grand(e) [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
column4: \nVotre sagesse et votre miséricorde sont légendaires. L’ordre Teutonique souhaite vous aider dans votre preulx combat contre les païens. Le transfert d’un comté frontalier à l’ordre nous permettra d’établir une présence locale et de guerroyer contre ces barbares.;Oh [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
column5: \nYEure Weisheit und Gnade sind legendär. Der Deutsche Orden möchte Euch bei Eurem heldenhaften Kampf gegen die Heiden unterstützen. Durch die Abtretung einer Grenzgrafschaft könnten wir eine lokale Präsenz etablieren und diese Ungläubigen bekämpfen.;;Al gran [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
column6: \nTu sabiduría y clemencia son legendarias. La Orden Teutónica desea ayudarte en tu valerosa lucha contra los paganos. Cediendo un condado fronterizo a la orden podremos establecer una presencia local y combatir a esos paganos.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18702;[From.GetTitledName] has graciously seceded the [Root.County.GetFullName] to us. The Livonian Order will now be able to effectively fight the heathens in this region.;[From.GetTitledName] nous a gracieusement cédé le(la) [Root.County.GetFullName]. L’ordre Teutonique va maintenant pouvoir guerroyer efficacement contre les païens dans cette contrée.;[From.GetTitledName] hat uns gnädigerweise die Grafschaft [Root.County.GetFullName] abgetreten. Jetzt kann der Deutsche Orden die Heiden dieser Region effizient bekämpfen.;;[From.GetTitledName] nos ha cedido cortésmente el [Root.County.GetFullName]. Ahora la Orden Teutónica podrá combatir con eficacia a los paganos de esta región.;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC18703;In an effort to defend [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName] against pagan attacks
column2: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] has granted the Livonian Order the [From.County.GetFullName]. This province has never been fully settled and many of the population are still heathens. This noble gesture could help protect the endangered frontier of [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName] as well as further the Holy War against pagans.;Pour défendre [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName] des attaques des païens
column3: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] a accordé le(la) [From.County.GetFullName] à l’ordre Teutonique. Cette province n’a jamais été totalement colonisée et la majeure partie de la population est encor composée de païens. Ce noble geste pourroit contribuer à protéger la frontière de [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName]
column4: actuellement en danger
column5: afin de poursuivre la guerre sainte contre les païens.;Im Bestreben der Verteidigung von [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName] gegen heidnische Angriffe hat [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] dem Deutschen Orden die Grafschaft [From.County.GetFullName] gewährt. Diese Provinz wurde nie vollständig besiedelt
column6: und die Bevölkerung ist größtenteils immer noch heidnisch. Diese noble Geste könnte dabei helfen
column7: die gefährdete Grenze von [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName] zu schützen und den Heiligen Krieg gegen die Heiden voran zu treiben.;;En un esfuerzo por defender a [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName] contra los ataques paganos
column8: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] ha concedido a la Orden Teutónica el [From.County.GetFullName]. Esta provincia nunca se ha poblado completamente y muchos habitantes son aún paganos. Este noble gesto podría ayudar a proteger la frontera en peligro de [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName] además de reforzar la Guerra Santa contra los paganos.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18720;The Livonian Order wishes to expand into the east Baltic in order to better fight the heathens. To show my support
column2: perhaps I should offer them a county of mine?;L'Ordre Teutonique souhaite s'établir dans la Baltique pour mieulx guerroyer contre les païens. Afin de montrer mon soutien
column3: je devrois peult-estre leur offrir un de mes comtés ?;Der Teutonische Orden möchte in den Ostseeraum expandieren
column4: um die Heiden besser bekämpfen zu können. Sollte ich ihnen vielleicht eine meiner Grafschaften anbieten
column5: um ihnen meine Unterstützung zu zeigen?;;La Orden Teutónica desea expandirse en el territorio Báltico a fin de combatir mejor a los paganos. Para mostrar mi apoyo
column6: ¿debería quizás ofrecerle uno de mis condados?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18721;My liege
column2: \nI wish to support The Livonian Order by grating them a county
column3: and seek your approval.\n\nYour humble vassal
column4: \n[From.GetTitledName];Mon seigneur
column5: \nJe souhaite soutenir l'Ordre Teutonique en leur donnant un comté
column6: et je souhaite votre accord.\n\nVotre humble vassal
column7: \n[From.GetTitledName];Mein Fürst
column8: \nich möchte den Teutonischen Orden unterstützen
column9: indem ich ihm eine Grafschaft übergebe
column10: und hoffe auf Eure Zustimmung.\n\nEuer ergebener Vasall
column11: \n[From.GetTitledName];;Mi señor
column12:
deseo apoyar a la Orden Teutónica otorgándole un condado y solicito vuestra aprobación.

Vuestro humilde vasallo
column13: \n[From.GetTitledName];;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18722;My liege
column2: \nMy vassal
column3: [FromFrom.GetTitledName] wishes to support The Livonian Order by grating them a county. I would of course not allow such an important decision without first seeking your approval.\n\nYour humble vassal
column4: \n[From.GetTitledName];Mon seigneur
column5: \n[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
column6: mon vassal
column7: souhaite soutenir l'Ordre Teutonique en leur donnant un comté. Il est évident que je ne prendroi point une décision aussi importante sans avoir obtenu votre accord.\n\nVotre humble vassal
column8: \n[From.GetTitledName];Mein Fürst
column9: \nMein Vasall
column10: [FromFrom.GetTitledName] möchte den Teutonischen Orden unterstützen
column11: indem er ihm eine Grafschaft übergibt. Eine solch wichtige Entscheidung würde ich natürlich nicht gewähren
column12: ohne zuerst Eure Zustimmung einzuholen.\n\nEuer ergebener Vasall
column13: \n[From.GetTitledName];;Mi señor
column14: \nMi vasallo [From.GetTitledName] desea apoyar a la Orden Teutónica otorgándole un condado. Por supuesto
column15: jamás permitiría tan importante decisión sin solicitar primero su aprobación.\n\nSu humilde vasallo
column16: \n[From.GetTitledName];;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18723;Your generous offer of grating a county to The Livonian Order has met with my approval.\n[From.GetTitledName];Votre offre généreuse qui vise à donner un comté à l'Ordre Teutonique a ma bénédiction.\n[From.GetTitledName];Euer großzügiges Angebot
column2: an den Teutonischen Orden eine Grafschaft abzutreten
column3: findet meine Billigung.\n[From.GetTitledName];;Vuestra generosa oferta de otorgar un condado a la Orden Teutónica cuenta con mi aprobación.\n[From.GetTitledName];;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18724;I will not permit that you cede any territory to The Livonian Order!\n[From.GetTitledName];Je ne permettroi point que vous cédiez une seule terre à l'Ordre Teutonique !\n[From.GetTitledName];Ich werde es nicht gestatten
column2: dass Ihr irgendwelches Land an den Teutonischen Orden abtretet!\n[From.GetTitledName];;¡No permitiré que se ceda ningún territorio a la Orden Teutónica!\n[From.GetTitledName];;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC18725;To the Great [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
column2: \nYour bravery is legendary. I wish to support you in your valiant struggle against the heathens
column3: and hereby offer to transfer a County to the order.\n\nSigned
column4: \n[From.GetTitledName];Au Grand [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
column5: \nVotre bravoure est légendaire. Je souhaite vous soutenir dans votre valeureuse lutte contre les païens
column6: et vous offre par la présente la cession d'un Comté à l'Ordre.\n\nSigné
column7: \n[From.GetTitledName];An den Großen [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
column8: \nEure Tapferkeit ist legendär. Ich möchte Euch in Eurem tapferen Kampf gegen die Heiden unterstützen
column9: und biete Eurem Orden hiermit eine Grafschaft an.\n\nGezeichnet
column10: \n[From.GetTitledName];;Al gran [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
column11:
Vuestra valentía es legendaria. Deseo apoyaros en vuestra valiente campaña contra los paganos y por la presente os ofrezco un Condado para la orden.

Firmado
column12: \n[From.GetTitledName];;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1900500;It has been some time since the members of my faction last met
column2: and letters have arrived requesting that I assemble the faction in [Root.Capital.GetName]. I can postpone it for a time
column3: but if I wait too long my position of leadership will be in jeopardy.;Cela fait quelque temps que les membres de ma faction ne se sont point réunis
column4: et certains me demandent de se réunir à [Root.Capital.GetName]. Je puis remettre ceci à plus tard
column5: mais si j'attends trop longtemps
column6: ma position de meneur sera sur la sellette.;It has been some time since the members of my faction last met
column7: and letters have arrived requesting that I assemble the faction in [Root.Capital.GetName]. I can postpone it for a time

column1: EVTDESC1900540;Swords have been sharpened and oaths sworn. My fellow faction members assure me that they are ready for war. The time to overthrow [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] is finally here.;Les épées ont été affutées et les serments prononcés. Mes compagnons de la faction m'assurent qu'ils sont prests pour la guerre. Le temps de renverser [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] est enfin arrivé.;Schwerter wurde geschärft und Eide geschworen. Meine Kolleginnen und Splittergruppesmitglieder versichern mir dass sie bereit für den Krieg sind. Die Zeit um [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] zu stürzen
column2: ist endlich da.;;Swords have been sharpened and oaths sworn. My fellow faction members assure me that they are ready for war. The time to overthrow [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] is finally here.;;;;;;;x;;

EVTDESC1900700;With a steady voice and eloquent rhetoric
column2: you deliver what is perhaps the greatest speech of your life. Praising your friends
column3: denouncing your enemies and subtly reinforcing your virtues
column4: you soon have the whole faction on their feet
column5: applauding and shouting your name.;Avec une voix assurée et une rhétorique éloquente
column6: vous donnez ce qui est peult-estre le plus grand discours de votre vie. Louant vos amis
column7: accusant vos ennemis et soulignant subtilement vos vertus
column8: la faction entière est bientost à vos pieds
column9: applaudissant et criant votre nom.;With a steady voice and eloquent rhetoric
column10: you deliver what is perhaps the greatest speech of your life. Praising your friends

column2: mispronounces words and forgets the name of an important noble in the room. What little applause there is at the end is muted by the jeers.;Les efforts rhétoriques de [From.GetBestName] pour rassembler les Seigneurs réunis à [From.GetHerHis] cause tombent dans l'oreille d'un sourd. [From.GetSheHeCap] bégaye
column3: écorche des mots et oublie le nom d'un noble important.Les quelques applaudissements sont étouffés par les huées.;[From.GetBestName]'s attempts to win over the assembled Lords with rhetoric falls on deaf ears. [From.GetSheHeCap] stumbles on phrasing
column4: mispronounces words and forgets the name of an important noble in the room. What little applause there is at the end is muted by the jeers.;;[From.GetBestName]'s attempts to win over the assembled Lords with rhetoric falls on deaf ears. [From.GetSheHeCap] stumbles on phrasing
column5: mispronounces words and forgets the name of an important noble in the room. What little applause there is at the end is muted by the jeers.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1900708;Mere seconds after you begin to speak to the assembled Lords
column2: you know that things are about to go badly. What follows are several long minutes of humiliation as you struggle your way through what you intended to be an inspiring speech. In the end
column3: you are laughed out of the room and uncermoniously removed from leadership.;Quelques secondes après avoir commencé à parler aulx Seigneurs réunis
column4: vous savez que les choses vont mal se passer. Ce qui suit sont plusieurs longues minutes d'humiliation alors que vous peinez à donner ce qui auroit du estre un discours inspirant. A la fin
column5: les rires vous chassent de la pièce et votre position de meneur vous est retirée sans cérémonie.;Mere seconds after you begin to speak to the assembled Lords
column6: you know that things are about to go badly. What follows are several long minutes of humiliation as you struggle your way through what you intended to be an inspiring speech. In the end
column7: you are laughed out of the room and uncermoniously removed from leadership.;;Mere seconds after you begin to speak to the assembled Lords
column8: you know that things are about to go badly. What follows are several long minutes of humiliation as you struggle your way through what you intended to be an inspiring speech. In the end
column9: you are laughed out of the room and uncermoniously removed from leadership.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1900709;Mere seconds after [From.GetBestName] begins to speak to the assembled Lords
column2: you know that things are about to go badly. What follows is the worst speech you have been forced to listen to in your life
column3: and the only thing louder than the jeers is the laughter. In the end
column4: the whole faction agrees to remove [From.GetFirstName] from leadership.;Quelques secondes après que [From.GetBestName] commence à parler aulx Seigneurs réunis
column5: vous savez que les choses vont mal se passer. Ce qui suit est le pire discours que vous ayez été forcé d'ouïr durant votre vie
column6: et la seule chose plus sonore que les huées sont les rires. A la fin
column7: les membres décident unanimement de destituer [From.GetFirstName] de sa position de meneur.;Mere seconds after [From.GetBestName] begins to speak to the assembled Lords
column8: you know that things are about to go badly. What follows is the worst speech you have been forced to listen to in your life
column9: and the only thing louder than the jeers is the laughter. In the end
column10: the whole faction agrees to remove [From.GetFirstName] from leadership.;;Mere seconds after [From.GetBestName] begins to speak to the assembled Lords
column11: you know that things are about to go badly. What follows is the worst speech you have been forced to listen to in your life
column12: and the only thing louder than the jeers is the laughter. In the end
column13: the whole faction agrees to remove [From.GetFirstName] from leadership.;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC1900713;Speaking to the assembled Lords
column2: I praised the virtues of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] and reminded my fellow vassals of our duty towards our liege. I could tell they took my words seriously
column3: and the meeting ended with an affirmation of our loyalty to the [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle].;En m'adressant aulx Seigneurs réunis
column4: j'ai loué les vertus de [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] et ai rappelé à mes compagnons leurs devoirs de vassaulx envers leur suzerain. J'ai pu me rendre compte qu'ils prenoient mon discours au sérieulx
column5: et la réunion s'est terminée sur une affirmation de notre loyauté envers [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle].;Speaking to the assembled Lords
column6: I praised the virtues of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] and reminded my fellow vassals of our duty towards our liege. I could tell they took my words seriously

column6: ses arguments faibles et sycophantiques n'ont point réussi à captiver l'audience
column7: tournant mesme une partie de la salle contre [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle].;Speaking to the assembled Lords

column10: and if anything managed to turn the room against the [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle].;;Speaking to the assembled Lords

EVTDESC1900728;Speaking to the assembled Lords
column2: I denounced the misrule of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] and reminded my fellow vassals of how our rights and liberties were being taken away. I could tell they took my words seriously
column3: and the meeting ended with agreement that we must find a way to reduce the power of the [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle].;En m'adressant aulx Seigneurs réunis
column4: j'ai accusé [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] d'incompétence et ai rappelé à mes compagnons nos droits et nos libertés qui nous étaient enlevés. J'ai pu me rendre compte qu'il prenait mon discours au sérieulx
column5: et la réunion s'est terminée sur l'accord général que nous devons trouver un moyen de réduire le pouvoir de [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle].;Speaking to the assembled Lords
column6: I denounced the misrule of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] and reminded my fellow vassals of how our rights and liberties were being taken away. I could tell they took my words seriously
column7: and the meeting ended with agreement that we must find a way to reduce the power of the [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle].;;Speaking to the assembled Lords
column8: I denounced the misrule of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] and reminded my fellow vassals of how our rights and liberties were being taken away. I could tell they took my words seriously
column9: and the meeting ended with agreement that we must find a way to reduce the power of the [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle].;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1900734;Speaking to the assembled Lords
column2: I denounced the misrule of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] and reminded my fellow vassals of how our rights and liberties were being taken away. Unfortunately they chose to distrust me

column5: ils ont choisi de ne point me faire confiance
column6: prétendant que j'avois mes propres motivations égoïstes pour essayer de les liguer contre le [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle].;Speaking to the assembled Lords
column7: I denounced the misrule of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] and reminded my fellow vassals of how our rights and liberties were being taken away. Unfortunately they chose to distrust me

column4: and only managed to further increase our loyalty to the [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle].;En s'adressant aulx Seigneurs réunis

EVTDESC190088;The civil war has completely destroyed my authority as a ruler. The realm has collapsed into independent vassal states
column2: leaving me with only my family holdings.;La guerre civile a complètement détruit mon autorité en tant que dirigeant. Le royaume s'est effondré en états vassaulx indépendants
column3: me laissant avec seulement mes exploitations familiales.;Die Rebellionen haben Eure Autorität als Herrscher zerstört. Das Reich ist zusammengebrochen und in unabhängige Vasallenstaaten zerfallen - Euch bleiben nur die Besitztümer Eurer Familie.;;The civil war has completely destroyed my authority as a ruler. The realm has collapsed into independent vassal states
column4: leaving me with only my family holdings.;;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC1901000;At the last meeting of the Princely Faction
column2: many voices were raised against [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s heavy-handed rule under the current crown laws. The whole faction has agreed to demand a reduction in crown authority from [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]
column3: at the threat of war.;Lors de la dernière réunion de la faction féodale
column4: moultes voix se sont élevées contre [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] considérant les lois du royaume trop contraignantes. La faction entière a décidé de demander une réduction de l'autorité de la couronne et menace de prendre les armes.;At the last meeting of the Princely Faction
column5: many voices were raised against [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s heavy-handed rule under the current crown laws. The whole faction has agreed to demand a reduction in crown authority from [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]
column6: at the threat of war.;;At the last meeting of the Princely Faction
column7: many voices were raised against [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s heavy-handed rule under the current crown laws. The whole faction has agreed to demand a reduction in crown authority from [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]
column8: at the threat of war.;;;;;;;;x;

column1: EVTDESC1901002;For too long
column2: the crown has restricted our historic rights and liberties. The time has come to lower the Crown Authority! Submit to this demand peacefully or face the consequences. Rest assure that I have gathered others who are equally upset...\n\nSigned
column3: \n[From.GetTitledName];Pendant trop longtemps

column2: there was many complaints about the heavy taxation of feudal lords. The whole faction has signed a petition to [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] requesting relief from taxation.;Lors de la dernière réunion de la faction féodale

column1: EVTDESC1901031;The tax demands placed on your faithful vassals is impoverishing our realms and endangering our ability to give military service to the crown. The Princely Faction formally requests a reduction in the tax burden on its members.\n\nSigned
column2:
[From.GetTitledName];Les taxes imposées à vos féaulx vassaulx appauvrit nos domaines et mettent en danger notre capacité à offrir un support militaire à la couronne. La faction féodale vous demande formellement de réduire la charge fiscale pesant sur ses membres.

Signé
column3:
[From.GetTitledName];The tax demands placed on your faithful vassals is impoverishing our realms and endangering our ability to give military service to the crown. The Princely Faction formally requests a reduction in the tax burden on its members.

Signed

column1: EVTDESC1903002;For too long
column2: the crown has restricted our historic rights and liberties. The time has come to lower the Crown Authority! Submit to this demand peacefully or face the consequences. Rest assure that I have gathered others who are equally upset...\n\nSigned
column3: \n[From.GetTitledName];Pendant trop longtemps
column4: la couronne a restreint nos droits historiques et nos libertés. Le temps est venu de réduire l'Autorité royale ! Soumettez-vous pacifiquement ou subissez-en les conséquences. Soyez assuré que nous sommes nombreulx et déterminés ...\n\nSigned
column5: \n[From.GetTitledName];For too long
column6: the crown has restricted our historic rights and liberties. The time has come to lower the Crown Authority! Submit to this demand peacefully or face the consequences. Rest assure that I have gathered others who are equally upset...\n\nSigned

column1: EVTDESC1903031;The tax demands placed on the church is hindering our ability to do the work of God. The Religious Faction formally requests a reduction in the tax burden on the churches.\n\nSigned

[From.GetTitledName];Les taxes imposées à l'église appauvrissent nos domaines et mettent en danger notre capacité à effectuer notre sacerdoce. La faction religieuse vous demande formellement de réduire la charge fiscale pesant sur ses membres.

Signé

column1: EVTDESC1904061;The burdensome levy privileges of the crown are an unjust imposition on the traditional rights of vassal lords. The Court Faction formally requests a change in the levy privileges law.\n\nSigned
column2:
[From.GetTitledName];Les privilèges lévy de la couronne sont injuste et vont à l'encontre des droits traditionnaulx. La faction courtisane vous demande formellement de changer la loi de lévy l'impost sur les privilèges 

Signé
column3:
[From.GetTitledName];The burdensome levy privileges of the crown are an unjust imposition on the traditional rights of vassal lords. The Court Faction formally requests a change in the levy privileges law.

Signed
column4:
[From.GetTitledName];;The burdensome levy privileges of the crown are an unjust imposition on the traditional rights of vassal lords. The Court Faction formally requests a change in the levy privileges law.

column1: EVTDESC1909520;Swords have been sharpened and oaths sworn. My fellow faction members assure me that they are ready for war. The time to win our independence is finally here.;Les épées ont été affutées et les serments prononcés. Mes compagnons de la faction m'assurent qu'ils sont prests pour la guerre. Le temps de l'indépendance est enfin arrivé!;Schwerter wurde geschärft und Eide geschworen. Meine Kolleginnen und Splittergruppesmitglieder versichern mir dass sie bereit für den Krieg sind. Die Zeit unsere Unabhängigkeit zu gewinnen
column2: ist endlich da.;;Swords have been sharpened and oaths sworn. My fellow faction members assure me that they are ready for war. The time to win our independence is finally here.;;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC200000;We started early
column2: the sun had barely risen above the horizon. There was plenty of prey
column3: the dogs caught many rabbits and I slayed one great boar before he killed my horse and myself.;Nous avons commencé tost
column4: l'astre du jour venoit à peine de percer l'horizon. Les proies abondoient
column5: les chiens ont pris moults lapins et j'ai occis un sanglier avant qu'il ne tue mon cheval et moi-mesme.;Wir fingen früh an
column6: die Sonne hatte sich über dem Horizont kaum erhoben. Es gab viel Beute
column7: die Hunde fingen viele Kaninchen und ich tötete einen großen Eber
column8: bevor er mein Pferd und mich selbst tötete.;;We started early
column9: the sun had barely risen above the horizon. There was plenty of prey
column10: the dogs caught many rabbits and I slayed one great boar before he killed my horse and myself.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC200001;The new bird is almost too perfect. I enjoy every hunt with her
column2: and the cook has trouble finding new recipes for rabbit.;Le nouvel oiseau est presque trop parfait. J'éprouve une grande joie à chaque chasse avec lui et le cuisinier à du mal à trouver de nouveaulx récipients pour conserver les lapins.;Der neue Vogel ist fast zu vollkommen. Ich genieße jede Jagd mit ihm
column3: und der Koch hat Schwierigkeiten
column4: neue Rezepte für das Kaninchen zu finden.;;The new bird is almost too perfect. I enjoy every hunt with her
column5: and the cook has trouble finding new recipes for rabbit.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC200002;I'm never happier than when I'm in my study
column2: poring over some newly imported volume. Books are truly God's greatest gift to man.;Je ne suis jamais aussi heureulx que lorsque je suis à mon étude
column3: étudiant de près quelques nouveaulx manuscrits importés. Les grimoires sont vraiment les plus beaulx cadeaulx que Dieu ait fait aulx hommes.;Ich bin nie glücklicher wenn ich über einem kürzlich importierten Buch brüte. Bücher sind wahrhaft das größte Geschenk Gottes
column4: des Allmächtigen.;;I'm never happier than when I'm in my study
column5: poring over some newly imported volume. Books are truly God's greatest gift to man.;;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC200003;I found the strange book collecting dust in a forgotten corner of the castle library. It took me several weeks of intense study before its mystery revealed itself to me. The gibberish parts was encoded and after many hours trying to decipher I managed to break it and construct a key to make it easier for me to read. Its mystery is still not solved...;J'ai trouvé ce grimoire poussiéreulx dans un coin perdu de la bibliothèque du castel. Cela m'a pris plusieurs semaines d'intenses études avant que je puisse percer son mystère. Les parties pleines de charabia estoient en réalité codées. Après maintes heures et tentatives pour les déchiffrer
column2: j'ai réussi à m'en défaire et à fabriquer une clé me permettant de lire plus facilement. Son mystère n'est toujours point résolu....;Ich fand das fremde Buch
column3: das Staub an einer vergessenen Ecke der Schlossbibliothek sammelt. Ich brauchte mehrere Wochen der intensiven Studie
column4: bevor sein Mysterium sich zu mir offenbarte. Die Kauderwelsch-Teile wurden verschlüsselt und nach vielen Stunden versuchend zu entziffern ich schaffte
column5: es zu brechen und einen Schlüssel zu bauen
column6: es leichter für mich zu machen
column7: zu lesen. Sein Mysterium wird noch immer nicht gelöst...;;I found the strange book collecting dust in a forgotten corner of the castle library. It took me several weeks of intense study before its mystery revealed itself to me. The gibberish parts was encoded and after many hours trying to decipher I managed to break it and construct a key to make it easier for me to read. Its mystery is still not solved...;;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC200004;My regular excursions into the dungeon have only served to whet my appetite. I have sent for a skilled torturer who will teach me more about the arts of pain.;Mes excursions régulières dans le donjon ont seulement servies à aiguiser mon appétit. J'ai envoyé quérir un bourreau talentueulx qui m'en apprendra plus sur l'art de la douleur.;Meine regelmäßigen Ausflüge in den Kerker haben nur meinem Verlangen nach mehr gedient. Ich habe nach einem Fachpeiniger geschickt
column2: der mich mehr über die Künste des Schmerzes lehren wird.;;My regular excursions into the dungeon have only served to whet my appetite. I have sent for a skilled torturer who will teach me more about the arts of pain.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC200005;My garden is the apple of my eye
column2: my pride and joy. I distrust my gardener and would spend every hour of the day in my garden if I could.;Mon jardin est la prune de mes yeulx
column3: ma fierté et ma joie. Je me méfie de mon jardinier et passerois ma vie dans mon jardin si je pouvois.;Mein Garten ist wie mein Augapfel
column4: mein Stolz und meine Heiterkeit. Ich misstraue meinem Gärtner und würde jede Stunde des Tages in meinem Garten verbringen
column5: wenn ich könnte.;;My garden is the apple of my eye
column6: my pride and joy. I distrust my gardener and would spend every hour of the day in my garden if I could.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC200006;My modest attempts to write poetry were never meant to be published in any way
column2: but wherever I go
column3: bards and minstrels are reciting or singing my poems.;Mes modestes tentatives pour écrire de la poésie n'ont jamais été publiées
column4: mais où que j'ailles
column5: bardes et menestrels récitent mes poèmes.;Meine bescheidenen Versuche
column6: Gedichte zu schreiben
column7: waren nie dazu gedacht veröffentlicht zu werden
column8: aber wohin auch immer ich gehe
column9: rezitieren Barden und Minnesänger  meine Gedichte;;My modest attempts to write poetry were never meant to be published in any way
column10: but wherever I go
column11: bards and minstrels are reciting or singing my poems.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC200007;After a long time of contemplation and soul-searching it feels as if I could bear to live in complete celibacy for the rest of my life.;Après un long moment de contemplation et de retour sur moi-mesme il semble que je puisse vivre dans un célibat complet jusqu'à la fin de mes jours.;Nach einer langen Zeit des Nachdenkens und der Gewissenserforschung fühlt es sich
column2: als ob ich die Last des Zölibat den Rest meines Lebens ertragen könnte.;;After a long time of contemplation and soul-searching it feels as if I could bear to live in complete celibacy for the rest of my life.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC200008;This lifestyle of utmost pleasure and joyous life suits me perfectly. This can be nothing but heaven.;Ce mode de vie plein de plaisirs extresmes et et de joie de vivre me convient parfaitement. Ce ne peult estre rien d'aultre que le paradis.;Dieser Lebensstil aud purem Vergnügens und freudigen Lebens passt mir vollkommen. Das kann nur der Himmel sein.;;This lifestyle of utmost pleasure and joyous life suits me perfectly. This can be nothing but heaven.;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC200009;The duel was close fought
column2: but in the end I was victorious over my opponent. As I basked in the admiration of my peers
column3: I knew that I had to do this again.;Le duel fut un combat serré et acharné
column4: mais à la fin je parvins à triompher de mon adversaire. Après m'estre enivré de l'admiration de mes pairs
column5: j'ai su que je devais le refaire.;Das Duell war knapp erkämpft
column6: aber schließlich war ich über meinen Gegner siegreich. Als ich mich in der Bewunderung unter meine Gleichen sonnte
column7: wusste ich
column8: dass ich das wieder tun musste.;;The duel was close fought
column9: but in the end I was victorious over my opponent. As I basked in the admiration of my peers
column10: I knew that I had to do this again.;;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC200010;I have finally become an expert in Islamic jurisprudence! My knowledge of the Qur'an
column2: the Sunnah
column3: Ijma' (Consensus) and Qiyas (Analogy) is what makes me a faqih and I will use that knowledge to be a better [Root.GetTitle] and ruler of my people.;Je suis enfin devenu un expert en jurisprudence islamique ! Ma connaissance du Coran
column4: de la sunna
column5: de l’ijmas‘ (le consensus) et de la qiyass (l’analogie) font de moi un faqish. J’emploierais mon savoir pour devenir un meilleur [Root.GetTitle] et guide pour mon peuple.;Ich bin endlich ein Experte des islamischen Rechts! Mein Wissen um den Qur'an
column6: die Sunna
column7: Idschma (Konsens) und Qiyas (Analogie) macht mich zu einem Faqih und ich werde dieses Wissen nutzen
column8: um ein besserer [Root.GetTitle] und Herrscher zu sein.;;¡Ya soy un experto en jurisprudencia Islámica! Mis conocimientos del Corán
column9: la Sunna
column10: la Ijma (Consenso) y el Qiyas (Analogía) es lo que me hace un faquí y usaré esos conocimientos para ser un mejor [Root.GetTitle] y gobernante para mi pueblo.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC20147;During a mission to try and fabricate a claim to a title
column2: my [Root.GetChancellorName] has been murdered!;Au cours d’une mission visant à essayer de fabriquer une revendication sur un titre
column3: mon Chancelier [Root.GetChancellorName] a été occis !;Während einer Mission
column4: auf der er versuchte
column5: einen Anspruch auf einen Titel zu fingieren
column6: wurde mein [Root.GetChancellorName] ermordet!;;¡Asesinaron a mi [Root.GetChancellorName]
column7: que intentaba falsificar un alegato contra un título!;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC20161;Someone has been spreading lies about me to my vassals
column2: saying that I distrust them and am unfit to rule. Unforunately it seems my vassals are receptive to this slander
column3: and my relations with them have been damaged.;Quelqu'un a été répandre des mensonges à mon sujet auprès de mes vassaulx
column4: disant que je manque de confiance a leur égard et que je suis inapte à gouverner. tristeusement
column5: il semble que mes vassaulx soient réceptifs à ces calomnies
column6: et mes relations avec eulx ont été détériorées.;Irgendjemand hat Lügen über mich verbreitet . Meine Vasallen
column7: glauben
column8: dass ich sie Misstrauen und bin unfähig zu herrschen. Leider scheint es meine Vasallen sind empfänglich für diese Verleumdung
column9: und meine Beziehungen mit ihnen sind beschädigt worden.;;Someone has been spreading lies about me to my vassals
column10: saying that I distrust them and am unfit to rule. Unforunately it seems my vassals are receptive to this slander
column11: and my relations with them have been damaged.;;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC20162;My liege
column2: I have managed to sow distrust between [From.GetTitledName] and [From.GetHerHis] vassals. I hope this pleases you.\n\nYour humble [Root.GetChancellorName]
column3: \n[Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledName];Mon seigneur
column4: j'ai réussi à semer la discorde entre [From.GetTitledName] et ses vassaulx. J'espère que cela vous plaira.\n\nVotre humble Chancelier [Root.GetChancellorName]
column5: \n[Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledName];Meine Herr
column6: ich habe es geschafft
column7: Misstrauen zwischen [From.GetTitledName] und [From.GetHerHis] Vasallen zu säen. Ich hoffe
column8:
dass das Ihnen gefällt.

Deinen bescheidenen [Root.GetChancellorName]
[Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledName];;My liege
column9: I have managed to sow distrust between [From.GetTitledName] and [From.GetHerHis] vassals. I hope this pleases you.\n\nYour humble [Root.GetChancellorName]

column1: EVTDESC20170;It seems that the [Root.GetChancellorName] of [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName]
column2: [From.GetTitledName]
column3: has been hard at work in [From.Location.GetName] trying to spread unrest among my vassals.;Il semble que le Chancelier [Root.GetChancellorName] de [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName]
column4: [From.GetTitledName]
column5: a œuvré sans relache en [From.Location.GetName] pour y propager l'agitation parmi mes vassaulx.;Es scheint
column6: dass der [Root.GetChancellorName] von [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName]
column7: [From.GetTitledName] sich hart an der Arbeit in [From.Location.GetName] Unruhe unter meine Vasallen zu verbreiten
